messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT DISEASES:
- Diabetic Retinopathy
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, etc.)
- Any eye/vision-related diseases

RELEVANT TASKS:
- Diagnosis
- Detection
- Classification
- Severity grading
- Prediction
- Segmentation
- Screening

RELEVANT METHODS:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, Transformers, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate this paper ABSTRACT for inclusion.
(This paper passed title screening)
================================================================================

TITLE: Research on Fusion of Clinical Indicators and Pathological Imaging for Diabetic Retinopathy Classification and Early Diagnosis
ABSTRACT: Meaning Diabetic retinopathy (DR) is a leading cause of blindness in diabetic patients with early diagnosis is crucial for preserving vision. It is a proposal of classification of the diabetes retinopathy by early diagnosis based on the fusions of the clinic indicators and pathological images. For the feature extraction from retinal images, we implemented a single Convolutional Neural Network (CNN). In this model, we leverage clinical data as ancillary information for images to enhance the diagnostic ability of the model via fusing with image features. To be more specific, the neural network structure has been modified to handle the temporal information in the clinical data, and weighted and coupled with the image features obtained by CNN. To enhance its performance, we incorporated a self-attention mechanism to refine the feature fusion of images and clinical data and utilized a hybrid optimization strategy to train the model. The experimental results demonstrate that the model is effective in classifying DR and performing early diagnosis, with accuracy up to 92\% and sensitivity for early diagnosis to 90\% which is much more than the traditional method, indicating that the method has great clinical application value.

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES (BE INCLUSIVE - DO NOT MISS RELEVANT PAPERS):
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Abstract_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Abstract confirms AI/ML/DL method for eye disease
- Abstract describes automated diagnosis/detection for ophthalmology
- Abstract mentions dataset of retinal/fundus/OCT images with ML analysis
- Abstract is UNCLEAR but suggests AI application in eye care
- Abstract describes deep learning model for any eye condition

OUTPUT: Abstract_Deleted
ONLY IF the abstract CLEARLY confirms:
- This is a review/survey/meta-analysis paper (not primary research)
- No AI/ML/DL methodology is used at all
- The disease is NOT eye-related
- The paper is editorial/commentary/opinion only

================================================================================
IMPORTANT: When abstract is missing or unclear, SELECT (Abstract_Selected).
We prefer false positives over missing relevant papers.
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Respond with EXACTLY one label only (no explanation):
Abstract_Selected
OR
Abstract_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
